caption:
Healthy Made Simple is out today! Changing my diet changed my life, it gave me my health back and ever since my mission has been to help more people to eat more plants more of the time. 

Healthy living should be joyful, colourful, abundant, flavoursome, and delicious 💫🌱 It should also be easy, so that you can eat well all the time. So, every recipe has five promises:

1. It’ll take 30 minutes or less. 
2. It’ll contain fewer than 10 ingredients 
3. It’ll have no more than 5 steps. 4. It’ll be healthy and packed with goodness. 
5. It’ll be delicious

I’m so proud of this book and truly feel like the luckiest person in the world to have a platform that can make a difference to other peoples lives. Thank you for letting me do what I do and I really hope the ease and simplicity this book brings to your life makes all the difference 💞

It’s in all book shops and Amazon now 👏🏻 Please let me know if yours has arrived!

Just a little reminder that when you find a lifestyle that’s sustainable, that’s wellness. When looking after your mind and body feels balanced, celebratory, delicious and full of abundance and colour, that’s wellness 💞 It’s not all or nothing, it’s not a life of deprivation; it’s nourishment, self-compassion and remembering that it’s what you do for decades, not on any given day, that matters✨

For the salad:
- 2 large sweet potatoes, in bite size pieces
- 1 can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 teaspoon of ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon of paprika
- 200g kale
- Pinch of chilli flakes
- Drizzle of olive oil
- Salt and pepper
- Fresh parsley

For the dressing
- 150g cashews
- 2 cloves of roasted garlic 
- 6 tablespoons of almond/oat milk
- 1 tablespoon of nutritional yeast
- 2 teaspoons of dijon mustard
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Pinch of salt

This recipe is from our well-being app; feel better 🌱 With 800 other delicious, plant-based recipes ✨

As a mum of two young girls, to show them this window of female founded brands and say ‘look at all these women’ doing incredible things, that can be you’ makes me incredibly proud. 

Love this #strongertogether campaign from @buywomenbuilt at @wholefoodsuk championing female founders for International Women’s day 💫 And love to see our best-selling peanut butter oat bars shining in the display!

Packed with plant protein, these sticky miso tofu bowls with peas, edamame and ginger are nourishing, flavoursome and super easy to make. Thanks @deliciouslyella. 

Ingredients 
2 servings of basmati rice, (about 100g / 3.5 oz) rinsed 
1 tablespoon olive oil 
Small chunk of ginger, (about 20g / 0.7 oz) cut into matchsticks/grated 
2 large cloves garlic, thinly sliced 
1 tablespoon tamari 
100g / ¾ cup / 3.5 oz frozen peas, defrosted 
100g / ¾ cup / 3.5 oz frozen edamame beans, defrosted 
Pinch of sea salt 

For the sticky tofu 
1 tablespoon olive oil 
1 block firm smoked tofu, (about 280g / 10 oz) drained & cut into bite-sized pieces 
1 tablespoon tamari 
2 tablespoons maple syrup 
2 tablespoons brown rice miso paste 
2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar 

Method  

Pour the rice into a small saucepan, along with 200ml / 7 fl oz water and a large pinch of salt. Bring to the boil, then cover with a lid, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes until all of the water has been absorbed. Remove from the heat and set aside. 
 
While the rice is cooking, warm 1 tablespoon of oil in a large frying pan set over medium–high heat. Add the tofu and cook for 10 minutes, stirring often, until crisp and golden on all sides. 
 
Next, whisk together 1 tablespoon tamari, the maple syrup, miso paste and rice wine vinegar. Once the tofu is cooked, pour the sauce into the pan and let it reduce to create a sticky sauce that coats the tofu. Remove the tofu from the pan and set aside on a plate. 
 
Pour 1 tablespoon of olive oil into the same pan, followed by the cooked rice, ginger and garlic. Fry for 5 minutes, until crisp, then stir in the tamari, peas, edamame beans and crispy tofu. Divide between 2 bowls and serve with your favourite crispy chilli oil/sauce.

‘If you believe in women, buy from them’. Honoured to be part of the @buywomenbuilt campaign bringing almost 40 female founders in the health and wellness space together @wholefoodsuk 💖

Never in a million years did I think I’d start a business or stand among such an inspiring group of female founders. So, moments like this feel very special and act as real markers of what we’ve built at DE.

Deliciously Ella has been built by our team, no one achieves great things alone. That team has always been made of mostly of extraordinary women though, with 5 out of 7 of our senior leadership team being women and Matthew consistently acting as the ultimate champion of female success, inspired by his mothers career. 

There aren’t enough female founders and projects like this are so powerful for showing what we can do when we come together. 

Cannot wait to show our girls this window at the weekend and highlight that they too can do anything they put their mind to 💖

I make this roasted garlic and creamy cashew dressing on repeat, because a good dressing instantly transforms simple veggies into something amazing! This recipe is so good with the sweet tender squash, golden roasted mushrooms, butter beans, kale and crunchy walnuts (lots of good omega-3’s in the walnuts too!)

With nine different plants, lots of fibre and plant-protein, it truly is a bowl of goodness! 
- Butternut squash
- Fresh rosemary
- Garlic
- Portobello mushrooms
- Tin of butter beans
- Kale
- Fresh parsley
- Walnuts
- Cashews
- Dijon mustard
- Apple cider vinegar
- Maple syrup

https://www.deliciouslyella.com/recipes/creamy-mushroom-and-butter-bean-traybake/

I’m making this on repeat at the moment, so wanted to share the recipe with you. It’s a family favourite, such a good staple and one of the easiest ways to up your veggie intake. It’s a nice one for food waste too, simply swap the veg for anything you’ve got lying around at home - leeks, whole tomatoes, courgettes, leafy greens etc are all delicious additions, likewise white beans instead of chickpeas and any pasta shape instead of orecchiette (broken pieces of lasagne are fab, as is orzo). Dial the chilli up or down to taste, or simply add it at the end if you’re making this for little ones (once you’ve served them) 

For the nourishing veggie broth with orecchiette, you’ll need 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 large onion, thinly sliced
- 2 carrots, halved lengthways & cut into 1cm half moons
- 2 sticks of celery, finely chopped
- 4 cloves garlic, crushed/finely chopped
- 2 bay leaves
- small handful of thyme sprigs
- 1 tablespoon tomato purée
- 1 tablespoon brown rice miso paste
- 1 x 400g tin chopped tomatoes
- 1 x 400g tin chickpeas, drained
- 1¼ litre vegetable stock
- 3 servings of orecchiette (about 225g)
- large handful of basil
- pinch of dried red chilli flakes
- pinch of sea salt

1. Warm the olive oil in a large deep saucepan or casserole dish set over medium heat. Add the onion, carrots, celery, garlic, a pinch of salt and cook for 5 minutes until slightly softened.

2. Stir in the bay leaves, thyme leaves, tomato purée and miso; cook for 2–3 minutes until fragrant. 

3. Next, pour in the tinned tomatoes, chickpeas and stock. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 10–15 minutes until the vegetables are tender. 

4. Remove the pan from the heat and use a hand blender to roughly blitz half of the soup to thicken it slightly (if you like), then return to the heat, add the pasta and cook for 8–10 minutes until al dente. 

5. Divide between bowls and scatter over the basil, chilli flakes (if using) and a drizzle of olive oil

The recipe is from our website/app alongside 1,000+ other delicious, plant-based recipes: https://www.deliciouslyella.com/recipes/nourishing-veggie-broth-with-orecchiette/

10 simple, delicious recipes to try this weekend 🌱

1. Chickpea, tomato & avocado toastie. Inspired by a tuna mayo concept, this is a super easy, quick (but delicious!) bite. 
2. Nutty sweet potato & quinoa salad with crunchy almonds and an extra creamy almond butter and tahini dressing.
3. Creamy broccoli pasta bake. With four different green veggies in it, this is an easy way to pack goodness into your life!
4. Pan-fried tomato hummus. Ready in 15-mins, this is so so good! 
5. Roasted cauliflower with butter bean mash. Surprisingly easy to make with less than 10 ingredients, full of fibre and so delicious! Butter bean mash is such a great way to get more beans in your life, if you haven’t tried it yet then really recommend. 
6. Nourishing veggie broth with orecchiette. Such a great weekly staple, packed with veggies and so nourishing. 
7. Coconut custard & berries toast. With just 6 ingredients, it’s a super easy brunch - almost the worlds easiest french toast! 
8. Storecupboard tofu & tomato curry. Filled with plant-protein, this is a one pan wonder that makes for great leftovers. 
9. Creamy kale & sweet potato salad. A favourite for over 10 years now! It’s the salad that keeps on giving 
10. Balsamic roasted barley & tomato risotto. A healthier twist on a classic risotto, using barley instead of rice. This is on our menu for the weekend! 

All on deliciouslyella.com and our app 🌱💫
